fields.description: Parity ticket see parent ticket for details on missing methods.

comments.body: We should take a look at github.com/yagitoshiro/ImageAsResized for the Android platform.
This module is generally good but crashes when resizing large images (such as those directly from the phone's camera).

Glad to see this implemented. But have you looked into using inSampleSize to return a smaller image for memory management? 

Thanks

Tested and verified fix with:
Titanium Studio, build: 3.0.0.201211071923
Titanium SDK, build: 3.0.0.v20121112140159
Device:
Nexus7 4.1.2
The behavior as described above.
Closing as fixed.

The test app does not include the test for "imageWithAlpha". This function adds an alpha channel to the image but the alpha value is 255 for the whole image which means the image is opaque. So we can not tell the difference between the input and the output image by eyes.
